Dialogue.content: Hi! I’m Maya Patel. It’s my first time here.
Hello Maya! Welcome! It’s great to meet you. What can I help you with today?
I’m feeling a bit frustrated about my new semester in biochemical engineering.
I’m sorry to hear that. What’s been bothering you?
I joined a group project on renewable energy sources, but one of my teammates, Alex, has been missing meetings and not contributing at all.
That sounds challenging. Have you had a chance to speak with him about it?
I tried reaching out to him, but he hasn’t responded. I’m worried about how this will affect our project’s success.
Hi there! I’m back. Things got a bit more complicated.
Welcome back, Maya. What’s been going on?
As the project deadline approaches, I’ve taken on more responsibilities to keep things on track. But now I’m feeling totally overwhelmed.
That’s a lot to handle! Have you spoken up about how you’re feeling during group meetings?
I tried, but my classmates said I was being too sensitive about Alex's participation. Now I'm feeling anxious about addressing any conflicts.
It’s understandable to feel anxious, especially when you’re trying to ensure the project succeeds. How about writing down your thoughts to prepare for the next meeting?
Hello again! I feel utterly burnt out now.
Hi Maya. I’m here to listen. What’s leading to this burnout?
With the deadline looming, I’ve been working late nights to cover for Alex. During rehearsal, I broke down, feeling like I failed the group.
That sounds really tough. It’s hard when you put in so much effort and still feel unsupported. Have you reached out to anyone for help?
Not really. I don’t want to burden my friends, and I feel ashamed for struggling.
It’s okay to seek support. Sharing your feelings with friends can lighten the burden and may even lead to helpful solutions.
I finally spoke up after our project presentation, and it felt refreshing.
That’s wonderful to hear, Maya! How did your friends respond?
They were really supportive and shared their struggles too. It felt good to connect over our challenges, but I'm still uncertain about my leadership abilities.
It’s normal to feel uncertain after such experiences. Have you considered what kind of support you might need to develop your leadership style?
I’m thinking about reaching out for professional guidance, but I’m still hesitant.
Taking that step shows strength and a desire to grow, which is commendable. I encourage you to pursue it when you feel ready.
Thanks for your support! I appreciate all the advice.
You’re very welcome, Maya! Take care, and remember I’m here whenever you need to talk.
